definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: The royal family of the Liang Dynasty was originally poor, not famous for its culture.
sentences.chinese: 蕭梁皇族本出自寒門，不以文化顯名。

sentences.english: They monopolize politics, repel commoners my impoverished family.
sentences.chinese: 他們壟斷政治，排斥庶族寒門。

sentences.english: Poor family out of wit, mountain Jun birds out.
sentences.chinese: 寒門出才子，高山出俊鳥。

sentences.english: Hes just a poor boy from a poor family.
sentences.chinese: 剛剛從一個貧苦的男童寒門。

definition: offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
born at the wrong time (idiom); unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate)/born under an unlucky star/ahead of his time
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
